title: Chile gold mine gets some sunshine with solar power
lead: The project is forecast to save approximately 104,000 tonnes of carbon dioxide over a ten-year period

title: Renewables ‘overtook fossil fuels as the EU main electricity source for first time in 2020’
lead: Wind and solar generated a fifth of Europe’s electricity last year, a new report finds

title: Australian government to build ‘futuristic’ net zero homes with Tesla batteries
lead: Homeowners could see their power bills slashed by AUD$1,600 every year

title: Boeing commercial flights to use 100% sustainable fuels by 2030
lead: The aviation giant has previously conducted test flights replacing petroleum jet fuel with sustainable fuels

title: Oxford to introduce ’30 by 25′ air pollution reduction target
lead: The Oxford City Council has set a 30µg/m3 of nitrogen dioxide target to be achieved by 2025, going beyond the current legal target set out by the UK Government of 40µg/m3

title: Canadian firm wins $1m for fully compostable and plant-based coffee pods
lead: NEXE Innovations’ coffee pods achieve 100% breakdown by composting within 10 weeks, with no negative effects on the quality of the resulting compost

title: Water companies pledge to provide real-time data on sewage overflows
lead: The Storm Overflows Taskforce has agreed to set a long term goal to eliminate harm from storm overflows as part of efforts to tackle river pollution

title: COP26: Groups invited to bring climate action to life in interactive setting
lead: Applications are now open to help shape the COP26 venue, with the chance to engage with key audiences and make a ‘real change’ in the fight against climate change

title: Ofgem calls for independent body to run the electricity system
lead: The energy regulator claims the new body could save consumers as much as £4.8 billion between 2022 and 2050

title: New programme to help retain New York’s renewable energy resources
lead: Proposals are being sought from existing privately-owned hydropower and onshore wind generators that entered commercial operation before 1st January 2015
